project: AI Hardware Design Review Knowledge Base

examples.title: Missing MCU Decoupling
examples.description: An MCU's main VCC pin lacks a local decoupling capacitor, leading to power rail instability.

expected_issue.summary: Missing decoupling capacitor on MCU VCC pin.
recommended_actions: Add a 100 nF ceramic capacitor (X7R) as close as possible to the MCU's VCC pin.
Ensure short return path to GND.

examples.title: USB Differential Pair Crossing Plane Split
examples.description: A high-speed USB 2.0 differential pair is routed across a split in the ground plane.

expected_issue.summary: USB differential pair (USB_DP/DN) crosses a ground plane split.
recommended_actions: Reroute the USB differential pair to avoid crossing any plane splits.
Ensure the entire length of the differential pair has a continuous reference plane beneath it.

examples.title: Op-Amp Input Exceeds Common-Mode Range
examples.description: An operational amplifier's input signal goes below its negative common-mode input voltage limit.

recommended_actions: Adjust the input signal biasing or supply rails to keep the input within the valid common-mode range.
Consider using a rail-to-rail input op-amp if the signal swing cannot be limited.

examples.title: Missing ESD Protection on External USB-C
examples.description: An external USB-C connector lacks dedicated ESD protection components on its data and power lines.

expected_issue.summary: Missing ESD protection on external USB-C connector (J1).
recommended_actions: Add a low-capacitance TVS diode array (e.g., USBLC6-2SC6) near the USB-C connector's data lines (D+, D-, CC1, CC2).
Ensure VBUS also has overvoltage/ESD protection.

examples.title: No Test Point for 3.3V Rail
examples.description: The main 3.3V power rail on the board does not have an easily accessible test point.

expected_issue.summary: Missing test point for the 3.3V power rail.
recommended_actions: Add a dedicated test pad (e.g., SMD test point or via) on the 3.3V rail for easier debugging and measurement during bring-up.

examples.title: DDR Address Line Length Mismatch
examples.description: A DDR4 address line in a group (A[0]-A[15]) has a significant length mismatch compared to others in its group.

expected_issue.summary: DDR address line A[7] length mismatch exceeds tolerance within its group.
recommended_actions: Adjust routing of DDR address lines to ensure all signals within the A[0]-A[15] group are length matched within the specified tolerance (e.g., +/- 5 mils).
Verify length matching using CAD tools.

examples.title: Buck Converter Excessive Hot Loop Area
examples.description: A buck converter layout where the input capacitor and switching components are not placed close together, creating an excessively large high dI/dt loop.

expected_issue.summary: Excessive hot loop area in buck converter layout.
recommended_actions: Re-arrange components to minimize the loop formed by the input capacitor, switching FET(s), and the ground path.
Place input capacitors directly adjacent to the VIN and GND pins of the buck converter IC.

examples.title: Inductor Insufficient Saturation Current Margin
examples.description: A power inductor in an SMPS circuit is selected with a saturation current rating that is too close to (or below) the peak inductor current under normal operation.

expected_issue.summary: Inductor saturation current margin is insufficient.
recommended_actions: Select an inductor with a saturation current rating at least 1.2 to 1.5 times the calculated peak inductor current.
Verify peak current calculations across all operating conditions (e.g., maximum input voltage, minimum output voltage, maximum load).

examples.title: Missing SMPS Compensation Network
examples.description: A switching mode power supply controller that requires an external compensation network for stability, but this network is entirely missing from the schematic.

expected_issue.summary: Missing external compensation network for SMPS controller.
recommended_actions: Add the required compensation network (e.g., Type II or Type III) as specified in the power IC's datasheet.
Ensure component values are calculated for the specific power stage parameters.

examples.title: Op-Amp Driving Large Capacitive Load
examples.description: An op-amp is directly driving a large capacitive load (>100pF) without any series isolation resistor, risking instability.

expected_issue.summary: Op-amp driving large capacitive load without isolation.
recommended_actions: Add a small series resistor (e.g., 10-100 Ohm) at the op-amp output before the capacitive load.
Consider adding a feedback capacitor across the series resistor to maintain AC feedback and stability.

examples.title: Incorrect Op-Amp Feedback Topology
examples.description: An op-amp configured for a simple buffer has an incorrect feedback connection, leading to unexpected gain or instability.

recommended_actions: Review the op-amp datasheet and standard application circuits to correct the feedback network topology.
Verify component values and ensure proper biasing for the desired function.

examples.title: Insufficient ADC Driver Bandwidth
examples.description: An ADC is driven by an amplifier whose -3dB bandwidth is insufficient for the ADC's sampling rate and input signal characteristics.

expected_issue.summary: ADC driver amplifier bandwidth is insufficient.
recommended_actions: Select an ADC driver with a -3dB bandwidth at least 3-5 times the sampling frequency or the signal bandwidth (whichever is greater).
Ensure the driver can settle within the ADC's acquisition time.

examples.title: Missing ADC Anti-Alias Filter
examples.description: An ADC input lacks an RC anti-alias filter, making it susceptible to aliasing noise from high-frequency components that can fold back into the desired frequency band.

expected_issue.summary: Missing or incorrect RC anti-alias filter on ADC input.
recommended_actions: Add an RC low-pass filter at the ADC input, with a cutoff frequency appropriate for the signal bandwidth and sampling rate.
Consider the ADC's input impedance and sampling capacitor when choosing R and C values.

examples.title: Poorly Isolated High-Impedance Sensor Node
examples.description: A high-impedance sensor input trace is routed long and close to noisy digital lines without a guard ring, leading to significant noise pickup and measurement drift.

expected_issue.summary: Poor isolation for high-impedance sensor input node.
recommended_actions: Route a guard ring around the high-impedance trace, connected to a stable reference (e.g., op-amp non-inverting input or ground).
Minimize the length of the high-impedance trace.
Increase physical separation from noisy digital or power lines.

examples.title: Missing ESD Protection on Data Lines
examples.description: Data lines of an external connector are routed directly to an IC without any ESD protection components.

expected_issue.summary: ESD protection missing on data lines of connector J2.
recommended_actions: Add appropriate TVS diodes or ESD arrays close to the connector pins for data lines.
Ensure proper grounding of the ESD protection components.

examples.title: Long Trace Between Connector and ESD Diode
examples.description: An ESD protection diode is placed several millimeters away from an external connector, leading to a long trace susceptible to inductive effects during an ESD event.

expected_issue.summary: ESD protection diode placed too far from external connector J3.
recommended_actions: Relocate the ESD protection diode as close as possible to the external connector pins (ideally within 1-2mm).
Minimize trace length and loop area between the connector, ESD diode, and ground.
